intro: Rosa afzeliana f. faucium, commonly known as the broad-leaved rose, is a horticultural form of the species Rosa afzeliana. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is native to Southeast Asia, particularly regions of China and Vietnam, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a parent plant in hybridization programs. The foliage is evergreen in warmer climates, adding year-round interest to the landscape.
